macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Q4 GDP Growth Disappoints at 1.4% vs 2.5% Expected
items.summary: US fourth-quarter GDP grew by 1.4%, significantly below the 2.5% forecast from a Dow Jones survey, impacting market sentiment ahead of PCE inflation data. Markets await potential catalysts like Supreme Court rulings and NVIDIA earnings.

items.title: US Supreme Court Overturns Trump Tariffs, Trump Plans New 10% Global Tariff
items.summary: The US Supreme Court ruled Trump's tariffs under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act unlawful, prompting markets to rally briefly; Trump responded by announcing a new 10% global tariff plus alternatives under other legislation.

items.title: US Stock Futures Dip Slightly Amid GDP Wait and Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: S&P 500 futures fell 0.18%, Dow futures 0.13%, Nasdaq futures 0.13% pre-market on Friday, pressured by Walmart's weak earnings outlook, US-Iran tensions boosting oil prices, and anticipation of GDP/PCE data.

items.title: Japan Flash PMIs Strengthen, Composite Hits 53.8 with Export Surge
items.summary: Japan's February flash Composite PMI rose to 53.8 from 53.1, the strongest since May 2023, driven by surging exports, record backlogs, firmer price pressures, and improved business confidence post-election.

items.title: AMN Healthcare Shares Rise 5.2% on Strong Q1 2026 Revenue Forecast
items.summary: AMN Healthcare stock surged 5.2% intraday on February 20 after Q4 2025 revenue beat expectations at $748.2M and Q1 2026 guidance of $1.23B exceeded analyst forecasts, closing up 2.4%.

items.title: Fed Rate Cut Expectations Hold for June Despite Weak GDP
items.summary: Markets continue pricing in the first Federal Reserve rate cut for June per CME FedWatch tool, even after softer-than-expected Q4 GDP data.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: One-Year Anniversary of Record $1.46 Billion Bybit Exploit by North Korea
items.summary: February 21, 2026, marks 12 months since the DPRK stole $1.46 billion from Bybit in the largest confirmed crypto theft, with most funds laundered via advanced tactics including mixing services and OTC trading. Elliptic warns of ongoing DPRK threats evolving with AI-enhanced social engineering targeting developers and infrastructure.

items.title: Bitwise Predicts More Bitcoin Price Shakeouts Ahead
items.summary: Bitcoin, down nearly 50% from its October 2025 high and trading in the mid-$60,000s, faces one or two more major shakeouts amid AI trade doubts, geopolitical tensions, and macro uncertainty, per Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan. The asset has behaved as risk-on rather than digital gold, diverging from rallying precious metals.

items.title: Digital Assets 2026 Report Spotlights Blockchain Advancements
items.summary: The 'Digital Assets 2026: Above the Noise' report analyzes future growth for BNB Chain, Ethereum, Solana, Uniswap, and Hyperliquid, highlighting scalability, interoperability, and user adoption as key drivers in the crypto market.

items.title: Binance Dominates CEX Stablecoin Reserves as Outflows Slow
items.summary: Binance holds $47.5 billion in USDT and USDC, 65% of tracked CEX stablecoin reserves, with outflows cooling to $2 billion monthly, signaling capital consolidation rather than sector exit per CryptoQuant.

items.title: Polymarket Bitcoin Prediction Market Sees Bearish Outlook
items.summary: Polymarket's 'Bitcoin Up or Down on February 21st 2026?' market indicates a bearish 1D trend/EMA with high liquidation risk from positive funding and open interest, despite short-term upside probes.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Framework Boosts Wireless Data Modelling to 142GHz for 6G Networks
items.summary: Researchers introduced NYUSIM, an AI-powered framework that generates realistic wireless channel data up to 142GHz, enabling digital twins for 6G and AI-native designs. The open-source Python version improves scalability over previous MATLAB implementations, validated through extensive statistical testing.

items.title: New 'VillainNet' Backdoor Attack Threatens Self-Driving Car AI Super Networks
items.summary: Georgia Tech researchers uncovered a vulnerability in AI super networks for autonomous vehicles, where attackers can poison a single subnetwork for a 99% success rate hijack, remaining dormant otherwise. Detection requires 66x more resources, highlighting urgent security needs.

items.title: Tech Giants' AI Spending Surge to $650 Billion in 2026 Sparks Market Skepticism
items.summary: Google, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft plan $650 billion in AI capital spending for 2026, up from $360 billion in 2025, fueling generative AI competition toward AGI. Recent stock selloffs erased over $1 trillion in value amid doubts on productivity returns.

items.title: 2026 Industry Report Highlights Edge AI Trends in Smart Grids
items.summary: A new analysis outlines major trends, drivers, and forecasts for edge AI in smart grids, focusing on AI algorithms to improve energy management and grid intelligence.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Internal Video Game Studio Atomic Arcade
items.summary: Hasbro has shuttered its internal video game studio Atomic Arcade, marking another closure in the industry.

items.title: Tencent Secretly Funded Struggling Shooter Highguard
items.summary: Sources reveal Tencent provided mystery financing to the struggling shooter game Highguard amid its development challenges.

items.title: ByteDance in Talks to Sell Gaming Unit Moonton for Over $6 Billion
items.summary: ByteDance is negotiating the sale of its gaming subsidiary Moonton for more than $6 billion, according to sources.

items.title: Unity Announces AI Tech to Prompt Full Casual Games into Existence
items.summary: Unity's leadership states that its generative AI tools will soon enable developers to create entire casual games via prompts.

items.title: Mewgenics Sells 1 Million Copies in One Week
items.summary: The game Mewgenics has achieved 1 million sales within its first week of release.

items.title: Valve Warns of Steam Deck OLED Stock Issues Due to RAM Shortage
items.summary: Valve has issued a warning about potential stock shortages for Steam Deck OLED models caused by a RAM supply shortage.

items.title: Call of Duty Ad Banned in UK for Trivializing Sexual Violence
items.summary: A Call of Duty advertisement has been banned in the UK for trivializing sexual violence.

items.title: Stop Killing Games Launches NGOs in US and EU for Game Preservation
items.summary: The Stop Killing Games initiative has launched two new NGOs in the US and EU to advocate for game preservation laws and monitor industry practices.

items.title: Gambling and iGaming Challenging Video Game Industry Growth in 2026
items.summary: A new report highlights how gambling, sports betting, and prediction markets are competing with video games for player time and spending in 2026.

items.title: HBCU Game Jam 2026 Begins Today at Spelman College
items.summary: The HBCU Game Jam 2026 kicks off on February 21 at Spelman College, with participants building games over 24 hours.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
